subject: Re: [junit] Database Select query checks!! newbie
msgSnippet: ... If you have that luxury, then the problem doesn t arise. We frequently have to make do with a database that already exists and being used by other
messageBody:
> No because you typically work with an empty test database. You then
> insert the data you will test. Your data is not time dependant anymore.

If you have that luxury, then the problem doesn't arise. We frequently
have to "make do" with a database that already exists and being used
by other groups. But i guess, if you create some rows specifically for
your testing and ensure that nobody else messes with those, that would
be a good solution...

> If you have an object that can be saved, updated and retrieved from a
> database, a nice way to test your SQL statement and your database is to:
>
> 1. create an object with valid data
> 2. store the object into the database
> 3. retrieve from the database into another object
> 4. compare that these two objects are equal

That is a good way. I have had this problem with testing database queries
and i have gotten some good ideas from the replies.

Thanks,
Nilesh
